titles.title: Industrial Emergency Notification Act
To require employers to notify local emergency officials, under the appropriate circumstances, of workplace emergencies, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bill.summary: 7/15/1998--Introduced. Industrial Emergency Notification Act - Directs the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to issue a regulation that requires employers to: (1) notify outside emergency responders when conditions and circumstances occur which require outside emergency response, including workplace evacuations and other conditions specified in such regulation; (2) describe in their emergency response plans or emergency action plans additional conditions and circumstances that require outside emergency response; and (3) obtain the written agreement of the outside responders as to such additional conditions and circumstances.
